prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To solve the problem of identifying a contradiction between the evidence and the testimonies, let's analyze the relevant pieces:

1. **Evidence 12 - Crime Photo**: This evidence suggests the arrangement of the way the dining tables and folding screen are positioned. It also tells us about the presence of a vase on each table.

2. **Testimony 3 (Armstrong)**: Armstrong claims that after the incident, he moved the mirror so that it wasn't in the way. This presumably refers to a partition or large object like the folding screen in Evidence 12.

3. **Testimony 4 (Armstrong)**: Armstrong further claims naturally, he did not touch anything else.

**Possible contradiction**:
- If Armstrong claims he only moved the mirror or partition because it was in the way without touching anything else, and we see from Evidence 12 that objects like vases on each table or positions of tables might have been due to moving things around the scene, then this testimony and evidence description could be at odds. Evidence such as the arrangement with the knocked-over coffee cup, tablecloths, or vase positions might not support his claim.

- Specifically, the phrase "I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way" contrasts with photographic evidence if other objects appear disturbed besides an expected reposition of the mirror. This makes the claim that nothing else was touched seem implausible.

For this reason, Evidence 12 (Crime Photo) could contradict Testimony 3 (Armstrong's movement of mirror affecting scene arrangements) by allowing us to infer that more than the "mirror" was disturbed. 

Therefore, the contradiction appears between:
- **Evidence 12** (Crime Photo)
- **Testimony 3** by Armstrong which states that he "move la mirror so it was not in z'e way" suggesting potentially more disturbances unclaimed.

JSON formatted result:
```json
{"evidence": 12, "testimony": 3}
```

Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1

Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im, just after 2 PM.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: Z'ere were no other customers.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: When 'e got word 'e won la lottery, Mon. Elg became very excited.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was approximately 5 minutes later z'at la poisoning incident occurred.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 6
Testimony: Non, z'ere was no time for a phony to do la acting.
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To find contradictions between the evidence and testimonies provided, we need to carefully analyze the details.

Let's focus on Jean Armstrong's testimonies and search for evidence that might contradict them:

1. **Testimony 0: La victim, Monsieur Elg, 'e came to my restaurant alone.**
2. **Testimony 1: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im.**
3. **Testimony 2: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im, just after 2 PM.**
4. **Testimony 3: Z'ere were no other customers.**
5. **Testimony 4: When 'e got word 'e won la lottery, Mon. Elg became very excited.**
6. **Testimony 5: It was approximately 5 minutes later z'at la poisoning incident occurred.**
7. **Testimony 6: Non, z'ere was no time for a phony to do la acting.**

Now, let's examine Testimony 3: "Z'ere were no other customers."

If Armstrong states there were no other customers at that time, then consider the **Victor's Testimony (Evidence 18): "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."**

Victor Kudo was apparently at the location and even broke a vase, which indicates he was present as a customer. This directly contradicts Testimony 3 where Armstrong claims there were no other customers.

Thus, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 by Jean Armstrong and Victor's presence in the restaurant as described by his testimony in Evidence 18.

{"evidence": 18, "testimony": 3}

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I don't know nothin' about no murder.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 1
Testimony: I was tied up with business in December last year. Spent all'a my time in my office.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 2
Testimony: The day youse talkin' about, I was in de office, too. I never saw that kid before.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 3
Testimony: I got whales lined up to borrow cash from Tender Lender every single day.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 4
Testimony: Youse wanna check my alibi, just ask Violetta.
Person: Tigre

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To solve this problem, we must find a contradiction between one piece of evidence and a testimony by Furio Tigre. 

Let's examine Tigre's testimonies and look for any contradiction within the context of the evidences:

- **Testimony 0**: "I don't know nothin' about no murder."
  - This is a general denial of involvement, so we need more specific evidence to directly contradict this statement.

- **Testimony 1**: "I was tied up with business in December last year. Spent all'a my time in my office."
  - This indicates that he was supposedly busy all December, potentially not having time for anything else. However, we can check for an evidence that places him elsewhere or indicates a different activity.

- **Testimony 2**: "The day youse talkin' about, I was in de office, too. I never saw that kid before."
  - Here, he claims he was in the office on the day of the incident and never saw Glen Elg before. If we find evidence that suggests he met Glen or was not in the office, it would be a contradiction.

- **Testimony 3**: "I got whales lined up to borrow cash from Tender Lender every single day."
  - Indicates business was buzzing, providing an alibi of having a full business day.

- **Testimony 4**: "Youse wanna check my alibi, just ask Violetta."
  - Suggests Violetta could confirm his alibi; not inherently contradicted by evidence proving a lack of alibi.

Now, let's cross-reference with potential contradicting evidence:

- **Evidence 6 (Small Bottle)**: The victim's ear medicine was found covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints -- this directly contradicts the notion of him not being involved as his fingerprints are on the victim's item. However, this doesn't directly contradict Testimony 3.

- **Evidence 20 (Glen's Calendar)**: On the day of the incident, it states, "Meet with The Tiger." This strongly suggests Glen Elg was supposed to meet Tigre, contradicting Testimony 2 where Tigre claims he never saw Glen Elg before.

- **Evidence 23 (MC Bomber)**: Found at Tender Lender, a computer virus made by Glen Elg, potentially connecting Tigre to Glen. But to find a direct contradiction, referring to Glen's Calendar might be better.

From this analysis, the piece of evidence that directly contradicts a specific testimony is:

**Evidence 20: Glen's Calendar**, with **Testimony 2: "The day youse talkin' about, I was in de office, too. I never saw that kid before."** This evidence suggests that Glen Elg was supposed to meet "The Tiger," Furio Tigre, which contradicts Tigre's claim of not knowing him or seeing him.

Therefore, the contradiction is found between Evidence 20 and Testimony 2.

{"evidence": 20, "testimony": 2}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
Let's go through the evidence and testimonies:

Reviewing the testimonies from Tigre, he claims:

- Testimony 0: He never met Glen Elg.
- Testimony 1: There was someone by Glen’s name, who wanted to borrow money.
- Testimony 2: He set up a meeting at Tender Lender.
- Testimony 3: He waited, but Glen never showed up.
- Testimony 4: He has never been to Tres Bien.

Now, let's examine the evidence:

1. **Glen's Calendar (Evidence 20)**: On December 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
2. **Sports Paper (Evidence 3)**: Contains a doodle in Glen's handwriting, found in Tres Bien on December 3rd, which is the same day he was supposed to meet 'The Tiger' (Tigre).
3. **Tres Bien Matches (Evidence 24)**: Found at Tender Lender, potentially linking Tigre to Tres Bien.
4. **Jean's Loan Contract (Evidence 8)**: Indicates Jean owes money to Tender Lender, having possible dealings with Tigre.

Let's look for contradictions between testimony and evidence:

- Tigre's Testimony 3 states he waited at his office for Glen, but Glen's calendar indicated a meeting with 'The Tiger,' implying it was with Tigre.
- If Glen intended to meet 'The Tiger' at Tender Lender (according to Tigre's story) but was found dead at Tres Bien, this suggests a contradiction.
- Evidence 3, the Sports Paper, was left by Glen in Tres Bien. It indicates that Glen indeed went to Tres Bien on the day he was supposed to meet with 'The Tiger'.
- Meanwhile, Testimony 3 says that Tigre was waiting for Glen, but Glen didn’t show up. Given Glen was at Tres Bien (as proved by the Sports Paper found there), this suggests Tigre's narrative isn't accurate.

Combining the above analysis:

Testimony 3 ("I waited around for him, but he ain't ever showed.") is contradicted by Evidence 3 (Sports Paper), suggesting Glen was indeed at Tres Bien, the location tying back to where Tigre was implicated.

The contradiction between Glen having planned to meet The Tiger (Tigre) and actually being at a different location suggests Tigre’s account isn't entirely truthful.

{"evidence": 3, "testimony": 3}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To find a contradiction between the evidence and the testimonies, let's examine each piece of evidence and testimony carefully.

First, we focus on Furio Tigre's testimonies:

1. **Testimony 0**: "I was supposed to meet wid the kid at the restaurant that afternoon."
2. **Testimony 1**: "When I opened the door to the joint, I saw one ugly scene."
3. **Testimony 2**: "The guy was laid out over the table, stiff as concrete."
4. **Testimony 3**: "I figured if the place wasn't hot already, it was gonna be, so I split."
5. **Testimony 4**: "I heard the cop's sirens on my way out, and I went straight back to my office."

Now, let's consider the evidences:

- **Evidence 3 (Sports Paper)** mentions a doodle by the victim that includes 'MC Bomber' with '100,000' scratched out and laughter drawn next to it.
- **Evidence 20 (Glen's Calendar)** contains a note "Meet with The Tiger" for December 3rd, corroborating Tigre's testimony of having a meeting.
- **Evidence 6 (Small Bottle)** indicates that Furio Tigre's fingerprints were found on the victim's ear medicine bottle, suggesting a possible interference.
- **Evidence 12 (Crime Photo)** and **Evidence 13 (Coffee Cup)** suggest the victim did not die instantly, as depicted by the coffee stain.
- **Evidence 10 (Glen's Autopsy Report)** reveals the victim died of potassium cyanide poisoning and notes the time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.

With these details, we examine possible contradictions:

- **Testimony 3** states Tigre left because he predicted the place would become "hot," implying he left quickly without seeing many details.
- If Tigre left quickly to avoid suspicion and didn't touch anything, his fingerprints shouldn't have been on anything related to the crime or victim.

However, **Evidence 6 (Small Bottle)** states that the victim's ear medicine was covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints, implying he interacted with the victim or the victim's possessions, contradicting the testimony of leaving quickly without involvement.

From this, we can conclude the contradiction is between **Testimony 3** and **Evidence 6**.

{"evidence": 6, "testimony": 3}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To find a contradiction, we need to evaluate the testimonies given by Furio Tigre and match them to the evidence related to the case.

We'll examine each testimony provided by Tigre:

1. Testimony 0: "Yeah, I loaned Elg cash. About 100,000 dollars."
   - This is consistent with what we know about the loan Furio Tigre provided to Glen Elg.

2. Testimony 1: "That day, we was due to have a little chat. The kid had hit his payback date, see?"
   - This agrees with the note in the victim's calendar about a meeting with "The Tiger".

3. Testimony 2: "So anyway, he tells me he's got no way to pay up."
   - This could be corroborated or contradicted by evidence about the victim's financial situation, such as race tickets or loans.

4. Testimony 3: "I'm about to flatten the guy, when he starts screamin'."
   - We need to find any evidence that supports or contradicts the victim's reaction.

5. Testimony 4: "'Yesss! I won! Half a million bucks!' He got lucky, you' know. Real lucky."
   - This relates to the Victim's Lottery Ticket (Evidence 14), which indeed is a winning ticket for half a million dollars.

6. Testimony 5: "If that waitress hadn't done what she done, everythin' woulda been over."
   - This suggests that Maggey Byrde was involved in a significant way.

7. Testimony 6: "Thanks to what she did, my business with that kid was over!"
   - Further implicating Maggey Byrde; possible contradiction?

8. Testimony 7: "I was after the $100,000. I didn't have no other reason to kill the guy!"
   - This testimony emphasizes motive related to the $100,000 debt.

Let's analyze Testimony 3 closely: "I'm about to flatten the guy, when he starts screamin'." 

In context, evidence related to this testimony would include any indication of Glen Elg's surprise or knowledge of his winning status. Evidence 14, the Victim's Lottery Ticket, corroborates the idea that Glen Elg discovered something very advantageous (winning half a million dollars). 

Looking into Evidence 14:
- This evidence is a strong positive event for Glen Elg, aligning with him allegedly saying "Yesss! I won! Half a million bucks!" 

Therefore, Testimony 3’s context of Glen Elg being about to be "flattened" and then having a sudden positive reaction is supported by Evidence 14. 

However, if Tigre indicated there was no way for Glen to pay (Testimony 2), the sudden scream due to winning the lottery contradicts Tigre’s earlier assertion that Glen had no means to pay.

Consequently, there is a mismatch and misunderstanding regarding the timing and awareness of Glen Elg’s resources, specifically related to Tigre's claim of Glen Elg's circumstances.

Thus, the evidence and testimony that contradict each other can be:
- Evidence indicating the Victim's state of mind with the winning.
- Testimony about the sudden reaction without other explanation (Testimony 3).

After careful consideration, this scenario shows contradiction between:

- Evidence 14 ("Victim's Lottery Ticket")
- Testimony 2 (Tigre's assertion that Glen Elg had no way to pay), as Glen should have known he won half a million, contradicting the claim that he was completely out of options.

Conclusion:
{"evidence": 14, "testimony": 2}
